samples.question: So, do you think people need to wear formal clothes when they are in the workplace?
samples.transcript: Like, from my deepest personal opinion, my answer is no. Because, like, people need to be, like, I do not know, like, this, this statement might be contradictory, but people need to feel comfortable when they are working. Like feeling comfortable in a workplace like that sounds very contradictory. But anyways, people like should not have to worry about like what they wear or what they what they are going to look like to other people in a in an office. But an exception would be that would be when you are meeting a client or a business partner, that is when you would need to kind of suit up and look professional, I guess. But most of the times, most of the time, I would say no. People need to feel as comfortable as possible in the workplace because it is already uncomfortable.

samples.question: And do people in your country wear traditional clothing?

And honestly like they looked I am not sure if I am supposed to say this word but dope. It looked really awesome. Because it had like both the factors of the traditional elegance and the modern simplicity. So like those two combined together like honestly looked really nice. So like people would wear like really, big jacket, sort of. If I had to like convert it to a modern cap or jacket like as cardigans and it looked really awesome. And I was like, man, I want to like, I want to like, get one of those and like wear one of them like from time to time. But I looked at the price tag and it was like super expensive. So I was like, nah. it is a lot of time. Great.

samples.question: Can we tell someone's personality from his or her handwriting?
samples.transcript: I believe so, yes. if it is very neat, very clean, very organized, you can really tell that person put a lot of time and effort into making sure that their message is clear, that they are a very organized person. But on the other hand, if it is messy and scribbled, then we can probably infer that maybe the person. has a lot of other thoughts or needs to go through things very quickly. And that results in handwriting being messy and not being easy to read I see Okay And what is the difference between writing with a pen and typing on a computer I believe the difference is accessibility. it is whatever you have at the moment right now. If you have a pen and you have ideas or if you have things you need to write, Then I believe that taking out the pen would be faster. But on the other hand, if you are sitting at a computer, or if you need to send an email to your boss, those types of situations, a computer and its accessibility would be more important. Okay, great. Alright, that is the end of your part one. So.
samples.transcript_original: I believe so, yes. samples.question: If you are more likely to help someone that you know than someone on the street, right?
samples.transcript: Most, it is a very sad truth, but when people, they ask for help on the street, a lot of people turn a blind eye. Because simply put, they do not know the person. It does not affect their own personal life. it is very selfish in a way, but it is unfortunately true. I do try to help people whenever like just strangers, because I do understand their position. I understand that relationship that that situation that they are in. So for example, if someone is lost and needs directions, I have been there before. I understand how that feels. So I always try to tend to help them. But most people, again, they do not. They do not have that thought. They do not have that, oh, this does not directly impact me, so therefore I will not help them. yes, I do believe that that is a core reason why. Okay, great.
